description: Total hysterectomy and salpingo-oophorectomy revealed a FIGO grade II endometrioid adenocarcinoma with less than 10% myometrial invasion, negative lymph nodes, and no extrauterine spread, consistent with stage IA disease.
patient_notes: Your surgery removed the cancer, which was confined to the inner layer of the uterus and had not spread to lymph nodes or other tissues. This is an early stage tumor (Stage IA), and no additional treatment is needed at this time. We will monitor your recovery with regular follow-up visits and imaging to ensure the cancer does not return. Please let us know if you have any questions or new symptoms.

verification.assessment: All extracted fields accurately reflect the pathology report findings. The tumor is correctly staged as FIGO IA (pT1a pN0 pM0) based on <10% myometrial invasion and negative nodes, and observation aligns with NCCN guidelines for early-stage grade II endometrioid carcinoma.
